column4: when running windows xp in virtual box where can i locate the C; drive in linux? I want to send some apps from my windows partition to my virtual windows "if that even makes sense"?
you have to mount the hdd image

Evanlec: is there a way I can mount my windows partition into virtual box so i can access it like that, if there is how do I do it, cause if my apps work well in virtual box there is no need to keep my windows partition
should be able to access it via samba
you'll need to install build-essential if you want to do C or C++ programming
thats a needle in a haystack I was hoping for something more obvious than that which has suggested programs that ueser have used... I hate getting apps only to find out they are crap
what sort of app are you specifically looking for?
we could start with a good html editor, VB - c++ compiler
html editor = any text editor, there is no VB compiler, build-essentialf or C/C++
your telling me they haven't got something close to frontpage for ubuntu that can't be right
well thanx ill look into those
frontpage is a horrible piece of crap
there are WYSIWYG web page creators, but they are usually always terrible
